description.p: Whis is a desktop application that transcribes your voice to text using OpenAI's Whisper API. Press a global shortcut to start recording, release to transcribe, and the text is automatically copied to your clipboard.

ul.li: Global keyboard shortcut (works in any application)
System tray integration with recording status
Automatic clipboard paste
X11 and Wayland support

screenshot.caption: Start recording from the system tray
Transcribed speech ready to paste anywhere

ul.li: Cross-platform build system updates

description.p: Smart close behavior for tray-less desktops

ul.li: Window now quits if there's no way to reopen it
Prevents users from getting locked out on desktop environments without system tray support
Add --install and --uninstall CLI flags for AppImage desktop integration
Support desktop environments without system tray (GNOME, etc.)
Fix Wayland window matching with StartupWMClass

description.p: In-app global shortcut configuration for Portal

ul.li: Add in-app key capture UI for Portal backends (GNOME 48+, KDE)
Register app_id with xdg-desktop-portal Registry for native apps
Better Wayland app identification

description.p: Bundle wl-clipboard in Flatpak for GNOME compatibility

ul.li: Use bundled wl-copy instead of flatpak-spawn
No longer requires sandbox escape permission
Use flatpak-spawn for clipboard (GNOME doesn't support wlr-data-control)

description.p: Flathub release with improved sandbox compatibility

ul.li: Use Wayland data-control protocol for clipboard
Renamed app ID to ink.whis.Whis
Removed unnecessary permissions

description.p: Initial Flatpak release with desktop application

ul.li: System tray with global shortcut support
Vue 3.6 settings UI
X11 and Wayland support via XDG Portal
